analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations in Reverse Order

original: 23.23. Saṅkiliṭṭhattika, Kusalattika🔽Nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… avigate cha.🔽Nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭhattika kusalattika  na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam na kusalam dhammam paccayā asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe avigate cha  na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam na akusalam dhammam paccayā saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Triad of the Corrupted, the Triad of the Wholesome

original: Nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With a corrupted and corruptedly defiled state as condition, a wholesome state arises, a condition being by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.) With a root cause, there are six. … With an unobscured and unobscured-undefiled state as condition, a wholesome state arises, a condition being by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.) With a root cause, there are three. … With an unobscured and unobscured-undefiled state as condition, a corrupted and corruptedly defiled state arises, a condition being by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.) With a root cause, there are three. … With an unobscured and unobscured-undefiled state as condition, an indeterminate state arises, a condition being by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.) With a root cause, there are six. … With an unobscured and unobscured-undefiled state as condition, an indeterminate state arises, a condition being by way of predominance condition. (Abbreviated.) With predominance, there are six. … With an unobscured and unobscured-undefiled state as condition, an indeterminate state arises, a condition being by way of absence condition. (Abbreviated.) With an absence, there are six. …
